bibl.title: Letter from Anna M. Sexton to Philip Showalter Hench, October 29, 1941

div1.p: Sexton requests reprints of Hench's article, which appeared in the journal "Hygeia."

div1.head: Letter from Anna M. Sexton to Philip Showalter Hench, October 29, 1941
div1.opener:
CABLE ADDRESS: “LABORATORY”
PUBLIC HEALTH IS PURCHASABLE
WITHIN NATURAL LIMITATIONS ANY COMMUNITY CAN DETERMINE ITS OWN DEATH RATE
EDWARD S. GODFREY. JR., M.D.
COMMISSIONER
PAUL B. BROOKS, M.D.
DEPUTY COMMISSIONER
DIVISION OF LABORATORIES
AND RESEARCH
AUGUSTUS B. WADSWORTH, M. D.
DIRECTOR
MARY B. KIRKBRIDE, SC. D.
ASSOCIATE DIRECTOR
ANNA M. SEXTON
LIBRARIAN
STATE OF NEW YORK
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH
NEW SCOTLAND AVENUE
ALBANY
October 29, 1941
Dr. Philip S. Hench,
Mayo Clinic,
Rochester, Minnesota.
Dear Doctor Hench:
div1.p:
I am writing to ask if we might have two copies of the
reprint of your article, “Conquerors of Yellow Fever,” in the October
number of Hygeia.

Doctor Lezear was a charter member of the Laboratory Section
of the American Public Health Association. Doctor Wadsworth is archivist
of the Section and would be glad to be able to add this reprint to the
archives that have been collected.
div1.closer:
Yours very truly, Anna M. Sexton
Librarian. AMS:MDM
